title: Plug-in. Episode 2
creator_credit: Salvador Castro, Simon Moule and C31 Melbourne
brief_description: Aired 07 April 2005. Plug-in is a fifteen minute television program that aired weekly on channel 31 in 2005 (season 2 scheduled from July 2006) . Each fifteen minutes consisted of a major and minor documentary as well as a vox pop montage relating to the major piece. Within this framework a broad range of material is presented, from profiles of the day-to-day workings of community organizations to documentaries and political animation. Plug-in presents material on indigenous rights and reconciliation, migrant issues, environment, education, health, culture, arts and dissent. In 2005 Plug In TV won 2 Antenna Awards (Australian Community Television Awards) for best editing, and best sound and was nominated for best show of the year.
